jobDescription: Position DescriptionCandidates for this position will be required to have an explicit understanding of Geographical Information Systems techniques and design. Knowledge of ESRI's ArcGIS software is required and a general understanding of pipeline systems would be a plus. Candidate will also have a fundamental understanding of GIS software development or configuration. Among the candidate's responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: utilizing ArcGIS Server to produce and maintain map services, configuration and support of web mapping systems like ArcGIS Online/Portal and GeoCortex Essentials, as well as utilizing FME scripts to support the enterprise. Responsibilities for the person in this position would include the following: Interact with ArcGIS Server to maintain, update, and create mapping and feature servicesConfiguration and support of Latitude Geographic's GeoCortex Essentials softwareConfiguration and support of ESRI's ArcGIS Online and/or Portal suitesConfiguration of ESRI's Web AppBuilderBuild and support existing scripts within the FME scripting environmentMaintain, digitize, update, and distribute GIS dataCreate, edit, and run models with ESRI Model Builder and utilization of Python scriptingAssist with GIS data updates and support as neededTrain Field Operations and other users on deployed GIS related software packagesInstall and support existing GIS software packages**Job level will be determined based on the successful candidate's experience and qualifications.** Position RequirementsEducationUndergraduate (Bachelor level) degree in Geosciences or other industry related degree from an accredited institution is strongly preferredAssociates degree in GIS/Engineering Sciences or 10+ years equivalent GIS technical experience working with pipeline databases may be considered Skills/QualificationsAble to demonstrate knowledge of GIS research methods and techniques to analyze spatial dataAble to communicate GIS technology and benefits to both technical and non-technical customers in order to develop solutions that fit their requirementsAble to demonstrate a technical understanding of the Pipeline discipline is preferred - including but not limited to GIS, Pipeline Database Systems (PODS, ISAT), Class/HCA Location Determination, components and characteristics of Pipeline material and data associated with the PipelinesKnowledge of GIS software development is not required, but would be advantageousAble to understand the relationships between data interfaces and knowledge of basic database structuresAble to demonstrate excellent customer service skills and the ability to work with all levels of management as well as employees in corporate and field officesAble to organize and prioritize daily work to meet schedules and objectives, maintain confidentiality and work with remote team membersAble to demonstrate interpersonal skills, analytical skills and the ability to analyze a problem from various perspectives and make sound recommendations as required.Able to be self-motivated and willing to learn new and changing technologies.Able to self-direct work activity and be able to maintain a close working relationship with reporting employees in multiple locations.Able to show proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite productsMust possess and maintain a valid driver license and a driving record satisfactory to the company and its insurersMaintain a high regard for personal safety, safety of company assets, employees, and the general publicPosition requires occasional travel We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
